title: Madrid's oldest cafe Café Comercial shuts its doors in shock closure
text:
6 shares 1
View
comments
One of the most iconic and historic cafés in Madrid has suddenly shut its doors after 128 years of operation.
Fans of Café Comercial were shocked when the eatery, often described as the oldest in the city, announced its closure in a Facebook post today.
The gastronomic haunt, where waiters were loved for their old fashioned dress sense, was frequented by many cultural Spanish figures.
Fans of Café Comercial were shocked when the cafe, often described as the oldest in the city, announced the closure in a Facebook post earlier today
Beloved by artists, singers, and even bullfighters, in its heyday many flocked to partake in literary debates over a morning cup of coffee.
Although the cafe's first license dates back to 1887, it's website says it was first launched in 1870.

Over the years, the Madrid property has become popular with many for its breakfasts, which include delicacies such as tomato bread, tortilla and churros.
The company's post thanked its fans calling the closure a shame.
The post said: 'After so many years of activity at the Café Comercial, we address you to tell you of our closure on July 27, 2015.
'It is a shame to have to write a message like this, but the time to close has come and we want to thank [you] from the bottom of our heart for the trust you have shown us over these many years full of wonderful experiences.'
The haunt, known for its revolving doors and waiters donning bow-ties, was frequented by many cultural Spanish figures
Beloved by artists, singers, and even bullfighters, many flocked to partake in literary debates over a morning cup of coffee
Many disbelieving customers commented on the Facebook post calling the news an end of an era.
'Incomprehensible!' wrote Pepe Machado on Facebook, 'How is one of Madrid's most emblematic cafes closing?'
Jon Matthew Ortega also commented: 'N . It is a tremendous error . It is part of the heritage of Madrid . A great loss.'
Since legal reforms put an end to the system of rent control, many family owned businesses have been forced to shut.
No explanation was provided by the café, and MailOnline contacted the company for further comment.
